text: Val-de-Travers is a municipality of the district of Val-de-Travers in the canton of Neuchâtel in Switzerland. It was created on 1 January 2009, when the former municipalities of Boveresse, Buttes, Couvet, Fleurier, Les Bayards, Môtiers, Noiraigue, Saint-Sulpice and Travers merged to form Val-de- Travers.Amtliches Gemeindeverzeichnis der Schweiz published by the Swiss Federal Statistical Office accessed 14 January 2010 The region is known for its production of absinthe. It is the largest municipality of the canton of Neuchâtel. == References == Category:2009 establishments in Switzerland Category:Municipalities in Val-de-Travers
title: Val-de-Travers
